Dm_RT_0040_004:
<snd:TuliAngry_00>Well, maybe I would if you didn't treat me
like a hatchling all the time!
Dm_RT_0040_014:
Still, every now and then, you get reports
among the Rito of a <clr:0000>flying ship<clr:ffff>.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0001>Combine that with the blizzard caused
by this <clr:0000>Upheaval<clr:ffff>, and it seems less
far-fetched.
Dm_RT_0040_024: You see the <clr:0000>two bonfires<clr:ffff> out that way?
Dm_RT_0040_005:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:LaughS_01>As long as you still think you can take on
the world by yourself, you'll always be my
little chick.
Dm_RT_0040_025:
<sp:3:0:2:0301><snd:Sad_01>My husband hasn't been able to leave
the village much since becoming the
village elder.
Dm_RT_0040_006:
<snd:TuliHowl_00>What, you think I can't? I'm already
fully-fledged, you know!<sp:0:4:0>You'll change your tune when I ace
today's scouting trip!
Dm_RT_0040_016:
<snd:TalkPositive_01>Even if the Song of the Stormwind Ark is
just a children's rhyme, I suspect that
there is something lurking high in the sky.<sp:0:4:0>But the air is so turbulent now that no
Rito can fly close enough to look into it.<sp:0:4:0>This is why I say we need to make careful
preparations to find the truth, but Tulin...<sp:0:4:0><snd:Sad_01>He thinks we cling to that song out
of cowardice.
Dm_RT_0040_026:
<sp:3:0:2:0401><snd:SurpriseM_01>What?! This is terrible news. So then, not
even Hyrule Castle is safe...<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0501>We Rito would ordinarily love to lend our
strength to your search.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:Sad_01>But this abnormal blizzard shows no sign
of stopping, and food has grown scarce.<sp:0:4:0>All the adults I could spare are already
out investigating the blizzard or
scavenging for food.
Dm_RT_0040_017:
You all can keep wasting your time
treating the <clr:0000>Song of the Stormwind Ark<clr:ffff>
like it's real, but not me!
Dm_RT_0040_018:
<sp:3:0:2:0401><snd:SurpriseM_01>What?! This is terrible news. So then, not
even Hyrule Castle is safe...<sp:0:4:0>If Princess Zelda's disappearance and the
strange phenomena around the world are
related somehow... Hm.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0501><snd:Sad_01>We Rito would ordinarily love to
contribute to your search.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0001>But this abnormal blizzard shows no sign
of stopping, and food has grown scarce.<sp:0:4:0>Everyone I could spare is already out
researching the blizzard or scavenging
for food.
Dm_RT_0040_028: <sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:Think_00>I wish there was something I could do...
Dm_RT_0040_010:
<sp:3:0:2:0001>Tulin wants me to let him go find <clr:0000>what's<clr:ffff>
<clr:0000>causing the blizzard<clr:ffff>, and he's having
trouble hearing "no."
Dm_RT_0040_020:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:TalkPositive_00>Ah! But maybe I'm not the one you want.
You should try asking <clr:0000>Harth<clr:ffff>.<sp:0:4:0>My friend Harth has many sources of
information, so he might already have
a lead about Princess Zelda.
Dm_RT_0040_001:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:Admiration_01>Link! They told me you were missing.
It's good to see you doing well.
Dm_RT_0040_002: <sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:Happy_00>It's very nice to see you again.
Dm_RT_0040_012:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:TalkPositive_00>It's an old folk song here in Rito Village.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0501>Long, long ago, when we faced a different
sort of <clr:0000>upheaval<clr:ffff>, the village was saved
thanks to <clr:0000>a great flying ship<clr:ffff>.
<sp:3:0:2:0001>Or so claims the song that's been passed
down through generations.
Dm_RT_0040_022:
<snd:TalkPositive_01>He's in the <clr:0000>lodge<clr:ffff> near there, if you'd like
to try visiting him.
Dm_RT_0040_003:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:TalkPositive_00>Do you remember my son, Tulin?
He's grown taller, though perhaps not
yet grown up.
Dm_RT_0040_013:
<snd:Think_00>It's a song for children, mind you. Few
adults still parrot it as if it were true.
Dm_RT_0040_023:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:TalkPositive_00>But these are Rito matters. You came for
some purpose, yes?
